edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.encryption

Interface SymmetricEnc

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AuthenticatedEnc, CBCEnc, CTREnc, SymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc, SymMultiplicativeHomomorphicEnc
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    OpenSSLCBCEncRandomIV, OpenSSLCTREncRandomIV, OpenSSLEncWithIVAbs, ScCBCEncRandomIV, ScCTREncRandomIV, ScEncryptThenMac

    public interface SymmetricEnc
extends Eav, Indistinguishable
    This is the main interface for the Symmetric Encryption family.

    The symmetric encryption family of classes implements three main functionalities that correspond to the cryptographer's language in which an encryption scheme is composed of three algorithms:

    1. Generation of the key.

    2. Encryption of the plaintext.

    3. Decryption of the ciphertext.

    Any symmetric encryption scheme belongs by default at least to the Eavsdropper Security Level and to the Indistinguishable Security Level.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)

    • Method Detail

      • setKey

        void setKey(javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Sets the secret key for this symmetric encryption. The key can be changed at any time.
        Parameters:
        secretKey - secret key.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given key does not match this encryption scheme.

      • isKeySet

        boolean isKeySet()
        An object trying to use an instance of symmetric encryption needs to check if it has already been initialized.
        Returns:
        true if the object was initialized by calling the function setKey.

      • getAlgorithmName

        java.lang.String getAlgorithmName()
        Returns the name of this symmetric encryption.
        Returns:
        the name of this symmetric encryption.

      • generateKey

        javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec keyParams)
                                   throws java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException
        Generates a secret key to initialize this symmetric encryption.
        Parameters:
        keyParams - algorithmParameterSpec contains parameters for the key generation of this symmetric encryption.
        Returns:
        the generated secret key.
        Throws:
        java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException - if the given keyParams does not match this symmetric encryption.

      • generateKey

        javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(int keySize)
        Generates a secret key to initialize this symmetric encryption.
        Parameters:
        keySize - is the required secret key size in bits.
        Returns:
        the generated secret key.

      • encrypt

        SymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext)
        Encrypts a plaintext. It lets the system choose the random IV.
        Parameters:
        plaintext -
        Returns:
        an IVCiphertext, which contains the IV used and the encrypted data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext does not match this encryption scheme.

      • encrypt

        SymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext,
                          byte[] iv)
                            throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function encrypts a plaintext. It lets the user choose the random IV.
        Parameters:
        plaintext -
        iv - random bytes to use in the encryption pf the message.
        Returns:
        an IVCiphertext, which contains the IV used and the encrypted data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext does not match this encryption scheme.
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - if the given IV length is not as the block size.

      • decrypt

        Plaintext decrypt(SymmetricCiphertext ciphertext)
        This function performs the decryption of a ciphertext returning the corresponding decrypted plaintext.
        Parameters:
        ciphertext - The Ciphertext to decrypt.
        Returns:
        the decrypted plaintext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given ciphertext does not match this encryption scheme.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
